messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Potty Training
messages.msgSnippet: I have a 3 year old-sometimes she goes to the potty, sometimes a diaper, and I could care less when she gives up the diapers. I know she will eventually, and
messages.messageBody:
I have a 3 year old-sometimes she goes to the potty, sometimes a diaper, and
I could care less when she gives up the diapers. I know she will eventually,
and when the time is right, she will do it.

Cathie

>
>
> >Speaking of toilet training, any ideas? My dd is 3 and almost 1/2 and
>she
> >seems to have no inclination at all to use the potty. Granted, she has
>had
> >constipation problems for over a year now which sometimes makes
>eliminating
> >painful, but please....
> >
> >Any advice would be appreciated.
> >
> >Bonnie
>
>
>Yeah, same here. My son is 3 and a 1/2 and shows no interest whatsoever.
>We keep the potty chair available in the bathroom and ask him if he would
>like to use it on occassion, but do not press. He has never had any
>problem with bowel movements or rashes, etc. But he does hate to have his
>diaper changed and that is often a struggle.
>
>Nanci K.

________________________________________________________________________

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Potty Training
messages.msgSnippet: Some childrens little bladders are just not ready to be controlled as early as 2, 3 or even 4.  I think pushing it is just harder on everyone.  We tried that
messages.messageBody:
Some childrens little bladders are just not ready to be controlled as early
as 2, 3 or even 4. I think pushing it is just harder on everyone. We tried
that for a week and about drove ALL of us crazy.

Julie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Potty Training
messages.msgSnippet: Here is a great site for potty training  Lee -Bee potty training and chore charts - an effective way of toilet training and
messages.messageBody:
Here is a great site for potty training <A HREF="http://www.lee-bee.com/">Lee
-Bee potty training and chore charts - an effective way of toilet training
and getting kids to do chores! Childrens, TOIL</A>

I used the potty training chart with my daughter. she is 2 1/2 yrs old and
she has been completely potty trained now for 3 1/2 months. I had her trained
in 5 days. but for about a month I had to wake her up once around midnight to
make her sit on the potty so she wouldn't wet the bed. But she is now doing
great with no accidents.

Hope it helps =)
LeeAnne
mother to two daughters Christina 4 1/2 and Angelina 2 1/2

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Potty Training
messages.msgSnippet: ... Yeah, same here.  My son is 3 and a 1/2 and shows no interest whatsoever.  We keep the potty chair available in the bathroom and ask him if he would like
messages.messageBody:
>Speaking of toilet training, any ideas? My dd is 3 and almost 1/2 and she
>seems to have no inclination at all to use the potty. Granted, she has had
>constipation problems for over a year now which sometimes makes eliminating
>painful, but please....
>
>Any advice would be appreciated.
>
>Bonnie


Yeah, same here. My son is 3 and a 1/2 and shows no interest whatsoever. We keep the potty chair available in the bathroom and ask him if he would like to use it on occassion, but do not press. He has never had any problem with bowel movements or rashes, etc. But he does hate to have his diaper changed and that is often a struggle.

Nanci K.
